text: Which word means 'very close'?
explanation: If something is near, it is very close to you.

text: If you look up, what can you usually see?
explanation: When you look up, you usually see the sky and clouds.

text: Which hand makes the letter 'L' shape when you hold it up?
explanation: Your left hand can make the shape of the letter 'L'.

text: What is a map typically made of?
explanation: Maps are usually printed on a piece of paper.

text: A big book that is full of different maps is called a/an ______.
explanation: An atlas is a collection of maps in a book.

text: What is a round model that looks like the Earth?
explanation: A globe is a round model of the Earth.

text: If you are far from something, what can you NOT do easily?
explanation: When something is far away, its smell might not reach you easily.

text: Which direction is the opposite of 'up'?
explanation: The opposite of up is down.

text: An 'X' on a map shows where ______ is. (Based on Lora's story)
explanation: In Lora's story, the 'X' on the map shows where Lora is.

text: Who gave her map to Lora so Lora could find her friend?
explanation: Maya gave her map to Lora.

text: Maps are important for ______.
explanation: Maps are useful and important for everyone to find places.

text: If Alex is standing on the ground, and he wants to see the clouds, he should look ______.
explanation: To see the clouds, you need to look up into the sky.

text: If something is 'near', you can smell it easily.
explanation: Yes, things that are near are usually easier to smell.

text: Your right hand helps you make the letter 'L' shape.
explanation: No, your left hand helps you make the letter 'L' shape.

text: A map is always a round ball.
explanation: A globe is a round ball, a map is usually flat paper.

text: A map can have a 'legend' to explain its symbols.
explanation: Yes, a legend (or key) on a map explains what the symbols mean.

text: If you are standing and look 'down', you can see the sky.
explanation: No, if you look down, you see the ground.

text: An atlas is a book that contains many different maps.
explanation: Yes, an atlas is a collection of maps in book form.

text: When something is ______, you cannot smell the trash very well.
explanation: If something is far away, its smell is too weak to notice.

text: If you are walking towards your friend, you are getting ______ to them.
explanation: When you move towards something, you get near to it.

text: If you drop a ball, it goes ______ to the ground.
explanation: Gravity pulls things down towards the ground.

text: To remember which is your left hand, you can make the letter ______ with your fingers.
explanation: Your left hand can easily form the letter 'L' shape.

text: The opposite side of your left hand is your ______ hand.
explanation: Left and right are opposite directions.

text: A map is a piece of ______ that shows places.
explanation: Maps are usually printed on paper.

text: An 'X' on a map can show you where ______ is, if you are reading Lora's map.
explanation: In Lora's map, the 'X' shows Lora's position.

text: A map can have a ______ to help you understand how big distances are in real life.
explanation: A scale on a map helps you measure distances.

text: Maya gave her ______ to Lora so Lora could find her best friend.
explanation: Maya used a map to help Lora find her way.

text: Maps are very ______ for everyone to find their way around.
explanation: Maps are important tools for navigation.

text: If you want to see the whole Earth as a round ball, you look at a ______.
explanation: A globe is a model of the Earth in the shape of a ball.

text: If Alex wants to find something in the sky, he should look ______.
explanation: To see things in the sky, you look up.
